oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Ausdünnung von Äpfeln durch Beschattung
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Widmer, Albert
Kockerols, Katharina
Gölles, Michael
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Fruit and berries
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Shading with nets of 2 m and 3 m width respectively, which reduce the photosynthetic active radiation by 74%, lead to successful fruit thinning of apple trees. In field trials, three days of shading reduced fruits per 100 flower clusters to a satisfactory extent for Golden Delicious (if shading occurred after 19, 26 and 33 days after full bloom (DAFB)) and Topaz (if shading occurred after 19 and 26 DAFB). For Elstar, seven days shading at 25 DAFB resulted in a good thinning effect. However, practicability of the method in commercial orchards has to be improved.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Widmer, Albert; Kockerols, Katharina and Gölles, Michael (2009) Ausdünnung von Äpfeln durch Beschattung. Paper at: 10. Wissenschaftstagung Ökologischer Landbau, Zürich, 11.-13. Februar 2009.
